text:
If companies are physically dismantling data center rigs abroad to smuggle Nvidia chips into China, the demand for compute is far more desperate than the charts show.

We aren't in a "tech bubble." We are in a resource war.

The biggest mistake AI agencies make? Thinking the client cares about the "AI."

The guy closing $18k deals didn't mention the tech once.

Clients don't buy "Reinforcement Learning." They buy "I get to go home at 5 PM instead of 8 PM."
